title: Gluten Free Irish Boxty
directions: Grate one potato, sprinkle with salt, and place in a sieve over a bowl. Periodically press on the grated potato to squeeze out excess starch and water.*
Peel the remaining potatoes and cut into large chunks. In a large pot, cover and boil the potatoes in salted water until tender, about 15 minutes.
With a fork, mash the potatoes with ¼ cup of the milk in a bowl until smooth. Add in the grated potato.
Whisk together the remaining ½ c milk with the egg, corn starch, flour, salt and pepper until smooth. Add to the potatoes and mix until smooth. Add any desired seasonings and blend again.

Heat a pan or griddle to medium –high heat. Test this by dropping a drop of water on the pan – if it dances across the pan it is ready. Add 1 Tbsp oil or butter to the pan. Scoop batter on pan in pancake-sized drops (about ¼ c full)
Fry with a lid on for 4-5 minutes, until nicely browned on the bottom. Flip, and fry 4-5 minutes uncovered on the opposite side.
Remove from heat and repeat. Serve warm with toppings.
ingredients: ¾ c milk or milk substitute
1 ½ tsp salt + extra for sprinkling
Flavourings as desired – I used ½ tsp garlic powder, ½ Tbsp rosemary and a pinch of dried parsley
